subject: Mental Health
title: Greek Humoral Theory
description: A quick win: understand Greek Humoral Theory.

hook.text: Hippocrates said depression wasn't caused by gods but by too much black bile.

buildup.text: The Greeks proposed four humors: blood, phlegm, yellow bile, and black bile.

discovery.text: Mental illness was seen as an imbalance of these bodily fluids, not divine punishment.

twist.text: This was revolutionary â€” it moved mental illness from religion to medicine.

climax.text: Humoral theory dominated Western medicine for nearly two thousand years.

punchline.text: Wrong about the details. Right about the direction.

quiz.question: What did Hippocrates attribute depression to?
